sub_topic: Finding the integral of a trigonometric function
message_2:
To find the integral of the given function, we need to integrate each term separately. 

∫(3sin(x) + 4cos(x)) dx = ∫3sin(x) dx + ∫4cos(x) dx

Now, we integrate each term:

∫3sin(x) dx = -3cos(x) + C₁

∫4cos(x) dx = 4sin(x) + C₂

Now, we combine the results:

∫(3sin(x) + 4cos(x)) dx = -3cos(x) + 4sin(x) + C

where C = C₁ + C₂ is the constant of integration.
